column4: Linux system files are password protected and we dont have that lame registry
not quite, but let's not get into that :)
I don't use one, but I think KDE has a Kcron. I prefer 'crontab -e' myself
'man 5 crontab' explains it. Only wart is that day and day of week and 'or'ed
the # means that line is a comment
thats what I thought.  When it was uncommented, it said there were errors
yeah, you've got a field too many I think
remove one of the 0s (assuming this is crontab -e output)
actually, I'll eliminate that one too
makes sense. You only want to run this once a year?
so all I need is 1 number then?
